How to Reset Your SSO Password

KB0012345 Knowledge Base: IT Support · Category: Accounts & Access > Passwords · Article type: How To
Published: June 15, 2025 · Last updated: August 1, 2025 · Owner: Service Desk
Summary: Use this guide to reset your Single Sign-On (SSO) password when you have forgotten it or your account is locked. Applies to all employees using Okta to access corporate apps.

Applies To

  • Employees, contractors, and interns with a corporate SSO account
  • Platforms: Web, iOS, Android

Prerequisites

  • Access to your recovery email or phone
  • Network connection

Steps

  1. Go to the SSO Sign-in page and click Need help signing in? → Forgot password?
  2. Enter your corporate email (e.g., jane.doe@example.com) and select Reset via Email or Reset via SMS.
  3. Open the reset link sent to you. If asked, answer your security challenge.
  4. Create a new password that meets these rules:
    • At least 12 characters
    • Includes upper- and lower-case letters, a number, and a symbol
    • Does not contain your name or previous 5 passwords
  5. Click Submit. You’ll see a confirmation message.
  6. (If you use a laptop managed by IT) Connect to VPN and lock/unlock your device once to sync your new credentials.
Tip: You can also reset your password from the Okta Verify mobile app: tap your account → Account settings → Reset password.

Troubleshooting

IssueResolution
Didn’t receive reset email Check spam/junk. Ensure you entered the correct corporate email. Wait 5 minutes and request again.
Phone number not recognized Use the email option and update your recovery phone in your profile once you’re back in.
Account locked Locks clear automatically after 15 minutes. If urgent, contact the Service Desk to unlock.
New password not syncing on laptop Connect to VPN and lock/unlock your device; if still failing, restart and sign in with the new password.

FAQ

Q: How often do passwords expire?
A: Passwords expire every 365 days. You’ll get reminders starting 14 days before.

Q: Can I reuse an old password?
A: No. The last 5 passwords are blocked.
